meanings.definition: An omnivorous domesticated hoofed mammal with sparse bristly hair and a flat snout for rooting in the soil.
meanings.sent1: The pig happily snuffled in the mud.
meanings.sent2: I saw a pig on the farm yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The pig wore a tiny hat and made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a pigsty, a real pig's den.
meanings.sent5: The pig's oink echoed through the barnyard.

meanings.definition: A greedy, dirty, or unpleasant person.
meanings.sent1: Don't be a pig and eat all the cookies!
meanings.sent2: He's such a pig, always taking more than his share.
meanings.sent3: The pig at the party kept spilling drinks everywhere.
meanings.sent4: She's a real pig when it comes to gossip, always digging for more.
meanings.sent5: The office pig never cleans up after themselves.

meanings.definition: A mass of metal or other material that is cast or molded in a particular shape.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a beautiful pig out of clay.
meanings.sent2: The factory produced a pig of iron for the machinery.
meanings.sent3: The pig of plastic gleamed under the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The pig of glass reflected the colors of the rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The pig of wax melted in the heat of the fire.
